Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 48 for SLE 12 SP5)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 48 for SLE 12 SP5)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.12.14-122_176 fixes several issues.

The following security issues were fixed:

- CVE-2024-41059: hfsplus: fix uninit-value in copy_name (bsc#1228573).
- CVE-2024-36964: fs/9p: only translate RWX permissions for plain 9P2000 (bsc#1226325).

Vulnerabilities.Description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

fs/9p: only translate RWX permissions for plain 9P2000

Garbage in plain 9P2000's perm bits is allowed through, which causes it
to be able to set (among others) the suid bit. This was presumably not
the intent since the unix extended bits are handled explicitly and
conditionally on .u.
